str2: Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Apparent, clear, visible, manifest; adv: clearly. From phaino; shining, i.e. Apparent; neuter publicly, externally.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To show, make clear, reveal. From delos; to make plain.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.
Of what kind or manner, of what sort. From hos and poios; of what kind that, i.e. How great.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
